supporting_text: The overall goal of the action plan is to ensure, for as long as possible, continuity of the ability to treat and prevent infectious diseases with effective and safe medicines that are quality-assured, used in a responsible way, and accessible to all who need them.
The NAP mentions specific actions in the human health sector, including awareness raising and training for healthcare professionals.
The NAP includes actions related to veterinary medicine and the use of antibiotics in animals.
The NAP addresses environmental factors related to antimicrobial resistance and includes strategies for monitoring and controlling environmental impacts.
The NAP includes strategies for monitoring antibiotic use in agriculture and ensuring food safety.
A monitoring and evaluation (M&E) Plan has also been proposed to keep track of the progress made and modifying the operational plan, if needed.
The NAP outlines specific objectives and timelines for achieving them.
The NAP includes targets for reducing the incidence of infections and monitoring antibiotic use.
The NAP includes a budget planning section that outlines financial requirements for various activities.
The NAP includes an assessment of budget requirements for implementing its strategies.
A National multi-sectoral committee was created for the governance of the plan.
The NAP includes strategies for improving regulations related to antimicrobial use.
The NAP includes educational initiatives aimed at increasing awareness of AMR among healthcare professionals and in school curricula.
The NAP outlines public awareness campaigns to educate the community about AMR.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of international collaboration in combating AMR.
The NAP includes strategies for establishing AMR surveillance systems and data collection.
The NAP outlines plans for enhancing capacity to detect and respond to emerging resistance.
The NAP includes specific strategies for infection prevention and control.
The NAP aligns with international standards and guidelines for AMR control.
The NAP includes strategies for regulating antibiotic distribution and use.
The NAP emphasizes the need for regulations to ensure the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP encourages participation in international research collaborations.
